body.p: A Kentucky businessman and politician. Educated at country schools. Married to Mary Q. A. Casey. Father of Harriet L. Casey and George F. Casey. Lived in Caseyville, Kentucky. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1860 to 1862. Served the First Congressional District of Kentucky as a Unionist member of the United States House of Representative from the 1862 to 1863.
